meanings.definition: A stick or post pointed at one end for driving into the ground as a boundary mark, part of a fence, support for a plant, etc.
meanings.sent1: She used the stakes to mark the edges of her garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer hammered the stakes into the soil to support the young saplings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the stakes were tiny swords for a duel.
meanings.sent4: The stakes stood tall in the field, like guardians protecting the crops.
meanings.sent5: The stakes cast long shadows in the setting sun, creating a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: A sum of money or something else of value gambled on the outcome of a risky game or venture.
meanings.sent1: He bet high stakes in the poker game, hoping for a big win.
meanings.sent2: The group pooled their stakes to buy more lottery tickets.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think the shiny stakes were toys to play with.
meanings.sent4: The stakes on the table represented the players' hopes and dreams.
meanings.sent5: The high stakes of the bet made everyone hold their breath in anticipation.

meanings.definition: The prize or reward for the winner in a contest or competition.
meanings.sent1: The trophy was the grand prize at the end of the high-stakes competition.
meanings.sent2: Competitors were eager to claim the stakes of victory.
meanings.sent3: The stakes for the race were delicious cupcakes, making it a sweet competition.
meanings.sent4: The stakes of the game were so tempting, everyone gave their best effort.
meanings.sent5: The shining trophy gleamed, symbolizing the high stakes of the challenge.
